title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 49-2.6 - Loss of Eligibility and Revocation
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 49-2.6 - Loss of Eligibility and Revocation

State Regulations
(a) The department may revoke an
institution's approval authority under this Subpart, based on a finding that
the institution no longer meets the requirements of this Subpart and/or based
on any one or number of complaints received, including but not limited to
complaints related to consumer protection, that raise a substantial question as
to the institution's ability to offer distance education programs to
individuals located in New York State. Within 10 days of the date of the
written notification of disapproval, the institution may appeal such
disapproval to the Commissioner or his/her designee in a manner prescribed by
the Commissioner. An institution that has had its approval revoked during
an approval period receives no fee refund, except as otherwise provided for in
section
49-2.7
of this

Subpart. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
§§
49-2.6

New

New

York State Register December 30, 2020/Volume XLII, Issue 52, eff. 12/30/2020

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
